capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's truly the boy who lived, and it's incredible to think about all he went through at Hogwarts. I mean, can you imagine being famous in the wizarding world from birth just because of a lightning-shaped scar on your forehead? It's no wonder he had so many challenges ahead of him.

You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's like a symbol of hope for many people, especially in the wizarding world. The fact that he was destined to be "the boy who lived" is just incredible. It's amazing how his life was forever changed after that fateful day when Lord Voldemort tried to kill him as a baby. I mean, can you imagine being famous and feared by so many people from such a young age?
capsules_submitted.reply: this sounds familiar. valeria, i think you mentioned harry as "the boy who lived" before.

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's truly "the boy who lived" - a legend in his own right. The fact that he survived that killing curse from Voldemort is just incredible. It's hard to believe it was all so real, and yet here we are, still talking about it years later. I think what's most remarkable about Harry is the way he handled all of that pressure and expectation as a child. He really did grow up too fast, but in many ways, it made him stronger because of it.
